org.hswgt.teachingbox.core.rl.policy.explorationrate

Class AverageCumulativeRewardBasedEpsilonDecrease

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hswgt.teachingbox.core.rl.policy.explorationrate.AverageCumulativeRewardBasedEpsilonDecrease
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AgentObserver, Learner, EpsilonCalculator

    public class AverageCumulativeRewardBasedEpsilonDecrease
extends Object
implements EpsilonCalculator
    Author:
    twanschik Decreases epsilon using an running average of the cumulative reward of an episode. Higher cumulative reward averages produce less exploration whereas low averages result in more exploration. Note that this method only works if we know the biggest available reward since we have to normalize epsilon!It's as if the agent knows that he can do better so he keeps on exploring if the average cumulativ reward is low and stops exploring with bigger and bigger average cumulative rewards. A StepSizeCalculator can be used to define how to average ( sample averages, exponential averages, ...) Default is to use a sample average.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
